result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael Angelo Gibson

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Michael Angelo Gibson not in court, in custody.  Attorney William Anthony Rakestraw Ii appeared by video for Michael Angelo Gibson.  Attorney Jacob Daniel Corr appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Scheduling Conference. Defendant not produced. Defense counsel informs court that they have received discovery materials. Parties are still in negotiations and are requesting a status conference date. Case adjourned to Br 16.
Status conference scheduled for December 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Michael Angelo Gibson appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney William Anthony Rakestraw Ii appeared by video for Michael Angelo Gibson.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Court took judicial notice of case #19CF2072. Sworn for the State: MPD Officer O. Espitia.    State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 16.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Letter from defendant.  (Michael A. Gibson - #2022008163, Milwaukee County Jail, 949 N 9th St, Milwaukee WI 53233).

Email correspondence with parties. Matter was originally calendared for a State V. Lee hearing, however SPD office has appointed successor counsel. Court re-calendars case for a preliminary hearing before prelim court on 09/21/2022 at 01:30 pm.
State Public Defender - Order Appointing Counsel.  Received and Filed.  nk

Defendant Michael Angelo Gibson not in court, defendant in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for cause to the trial court for a State V. Lee Hearing.  Hearing scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed. OSPD APPOINTMENT OF COUNSEL REPORT

Defendant Michael Angelo Gibson not in court, defendant in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed. OSPD APPOINTMENT OF COUNSEL REPORT

Defendant Michael Angelo Gibson not in court, defendant in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for preliminary hearing. States witness is present. OPD needs additional time to appoint an attorney. State request the matter be set for a State V. Lee hearing or status; denied.  Court finds good CAUSE to adjourn preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered no contact with JAG.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.
  No possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription.
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

HELD OFF THE RECORD DUE TO TECHNICAL DIFFICULTIES: 
 Defendant Michael Angelo Gibson in court with attorney William Scott Nelson.  Defendant Michael Angelo Gibson in custody.  Jennifer Jean Tate appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
